SECRET.
BATTLE SITUATION ? EVENING - 21st AUGUST, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front. The attack commenced by the 3rd Army this morning continues to progress satisfactorily, but no definite information has been received as to the actual line reached beyond that given in the NOON BATTLE SITUATION. A thick fog has made communication somewhat difficult. It is believed however that the general line reached is that of the railway running east of COURCELLE, ACHIET-LE-PETIT, and BEAUCOURT.
French Front. The 10th French Army continues to press its attack between the OISE and the AISNE and has now reached the line of the OISE between SEMPIGNY and P0NT0ISE. The situation west of the OISE is not known. The line from the OISE to the AISNE now runs as follows :- SEMPIGNY,(German), along the OISE to PONTOISE, (French) thence uncertain to CUTS, (French), CAMELIN, (doubtful), BLERAN COURT, (French), ST. AUBIN, (German), west and south of SELENS, VEZAPONIN, (French), BIEUXY, (German), east of TARTIERS and LAVAL, east of COURTIL.
2. ITALIAN AND MACEDONIAN FRONTS.
There is nothing to report.
?ral Staff,
War Office, S.W.1.
21st August, 1918.
?ed at 6-30 p.m.
